description: Borrowed from French bonhomie, bonhommie (“good-heartedness; extreme credulity”), from bonhomme (“chap, fellow; courageous man; peasant; unwise man who allows himself to be deceived and dominated”) (from bon (“good”) + homme (“man”)) + -ie (suffix forming feminine, usually abstract, nouns).

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A friendly, good-natured, pleasant manner; an affable and approachable disposition; friendliness.
examples: Synonyms: affability, geniality; see also Thesaurus:friendliness

entries.meaning: (uncountable) An atmosphere of friendliness and good cheer.
examples: Synonyms: conviviality, (Ireland, Northern England) craic, warmth
